intro: Pleurothallis disticha, commonly known as the two-branched orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow. Its flowers are often short-lived but attract various pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is valued in both horticultural and conservation contexts.
